heading: ***WINTER STORM WARNINGS IN SOUTHERN-MOST COUNTIES INTO MA THROUGH THIS EVENING, EXCEPT WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES IN NH FROM HANOVER SOUTH TO CHARLESTOWN***Today
text: Heavy snow and blowing snow in southern counties, 4 to 10 inches, decreasing to light north to Rt. 4 and Plymouth, NH, 1 to 3 inches, tapering off this afternoon. Little if anything farther north. Highs in the 20s. Winds northeast, becoming north 10 to 25 mph, gusting 25 to 35 mph, up to 45 mph over the higher terrain south.

heading: Tonight
text: Any snow showers ending. Clouds starting to break. Blustery and cold. Lows in the teens south 5 to 10 north, near zero in the Adirondacks. Winds north, becoming northwest 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 30 mph east of the Green Mountains.

heading: Tuesday
text: Clouds giving way to sunshine. Brisk and cold. Highs only in the teens to near 20 north, in the 20s south. Northwest winds 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 30 mph through NH, decreasing in the afternoon.
